metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: AngularJS has directives for binding application data to the attributes of HTML DOM elements.
content.html: AngularJS has directives for binding application data to the attributes of HTML DOM elements.

content.text: The ng-disabled directive binds AngularJS application data to the disabled attribute of HTML elements.
content.html: The ng-disabled directive binds AngularJS application data to the disabled attribute of HTML elements.

content.code:
Button

{{ mySwitch }}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="mySwitch=true">

<p>
<button ng-disabled="mySwitch">Click Me!</button>
</p>

<p>
<input type="checkbox" ng-model="mySwitch">Button
</p>

<p>
{{ mySwitch }}
</p>

</div>

content.text: The ng-disabled directive binds the application data mySwitch to the HTML button's disabled attribute.
content.html: The ng-disabled directive binds the application data mySwitch to the HTML button's disabled attribute.

content.text: The ng-model directive binds the value of the HTML checkbox element to the value of mySwitch .
content.html: The ng-model directive binds the value of the HTML checkbox element to the value of mySwitch.

content.text: If the value of mySwitch evaluates to true , the button will be disabled:
content.html: If the value of mySwitch evaluates to true, the button will be disabled:

content.code_html:
<p>
<button disabled>Click Me!</button>
</p>

content.text: If the value of mySwitch evaluates to false , the button will not be disabled:
content.html: If the value of mySwitch evaluates to false, the button will not be disabled:

content.code_html:
<p>
<button>Click Me!</button>
</p>

content.text: The ng-show directive shows or hides an HTML element.
content.html: The ng-show directive shows or hides an HTML element.

content.code:
I am visible.

I am not visible.
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="">

<p ng-show="true">I am visible.</p>

<p ng-show="false">I am not visible.</p>

</div>

content.text: The ng-show directive shows (or hides) an HTML element based on the value of ng-show.
content.html: The ng-show directive shows (or hides) an HTML element based on the value of ng-show.

content.text: You can use any expression that evaluates to true or false:
content.html: You can use any expression that evaluates to true or false:

content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="hour=13">

<p ng-show="hour > 12">I am visible.</p>

</div>

content.text: In the next chapter, there are more examples, using the click of a button to hide HTML elements.
content.html: In the next chapter, there are more examples, using the click of a button to hide HTML elements.

content.text: The ng-hide directive hides or shows an HTML element.
content.html: The ng-hide directive hides or shows an HTML element.

content.code:
I am not visible.

I am visible.
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="">

<p ng-hide="true">I am not visible.</p>

<p ng-hide="false">I am visible.</p>

</div>
